title: How to Sponge Bathe a Long Haired Cat

steps.title: Prepare the sponge bath.
steps.content: Prepare the sponge bath. You will need: A bowl of warm water Gentle soap (castile soap is ideal) A sponge or a chamois.

steps.title: Dip the sponge or chamois in the warm water.
steps.content: Dip the sponge or chamois in the warm water.

steps.title: Gently run the sponge across your cat, cleaning as much of her fur as possible.
steps.content: Gently run the sponge across your cat, cleaning as much of her fur as possible. When you are happy that she is dampened enough, leave her to dry.

steps.title: Using a suitable grooming brush, brush your cat's hair.
steps.content: Using a suitable grooming brush, brush your cat's hair. When you find knots, be very gentle. Use fine scissors to cut out knots that won't groom out.

steps.title: Groom regularly after the bath.
steps.content: Groom regularly after the bath. This will prevent the build-up of bad knots.
